October 29, 2020 Reshaping the Guest Experience - Virtual Webinar Join NCR for a virtual webinar <[[https://on.lenos.com/ncr/reshapingtheguestexperience-virtualwebinar/Content/Overview]]>, “Reshaping the Guest Experience,” on November 10, 2020 at 1:00 p.m. ET, to learn more about best practices that peers in the hospitality industry have implemented to improve curbside, delivery, pickup, and dine-in experiences. We’ll explore several easy-to-implement strategies for reducing friction for your guests that will help your restaurant emerge successfully from the pandemic and beyond. Register today! <[[https://on.lenos.com/ncr/reshapingtheguestexperience-virtualwebinar/Content/Overview]]> We are looking forward to seeing you.
Featured Speaker: Jessica Bryant, Executive Director Marketing, NCR Hospitality NCR Travel Kiosk Services Discontinuation The NCR travel kiosk terminals listed here <[[https://ncr.quickbase.com/up/bqe6gx23b/g/rbp/ek/va/Travel%20Kiosk%20Discontinuation%20Notice.pdf]]> have ended production and are now in “service only mode.” These products will soon reach the “end of service life” (EOL) threshold. If a customer has these units being covered by a service contract, NCR may attempt to extend the service life where possible, although special pricing would apply. Read more. <[[https://ncr.quickbase.com/up/bqe6gx23b/g/rbp/ek/va/Travel%20Kiosk%20Discontinuation%20Notice.pdf]]>
Last Chance to Register for TechFest 2020 TechFest 2020 registration closes Friday, October 30th. Reserve your spot today!
Unleash the power of simplicity for restaurants now by participating in numerous technical workshops that NCR is offering exclusively at TechFest 2020. Join your peers in the Hospitality industry to learn and collaborate in a virtual setting, while also having a little fun.
Here’s a small sampling of some of the workshops available:
- Implementing Contactless Dine-In - Aloha Kitchen and Aloha Takeout integration - Menu and Order Services – integrating with 3rd party applications - Implementing NCR Order Pay - Wireless implementation best practices - And much, much more! Migration of Aloha Online Ordering to Public Cloud The migration of Aloha Online Ordering to the public cloud began last week in a phased approach. A communication was sent to all impacted customers explaining the administrative changes they must complete to access Web Admin and Menu Configurator after their Aloha Online Ordering site has been migrated. Please share the detailed instructions located here <[[https://ncr.quickbase.com/up/bqe6gx23b/g/rbn/ek/va/Aloha Online Azure Cloud Migration.docx]]> with your customers about actions that must be completed to ensure there is no disruption when their site is migrated.
